title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 690.12 - Procedure at hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 690.12 - Procedure at hearing

State Regulations

At the hearing, hearsay evidence may
be received and considered and adherence to strict rules of evidence shall not
be required. The applicant shall be given an opportunity to call and
cross-examine witnesses and to challenge, examine and controvert any adverse
evidence. Upon timely request, subpoenas for the attendance of witnesses or the
production of papers shall be issued to the applicant by the clerk of the

Appellate Division, the subpoena fees and mileage to be paid by the
applicant. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
690.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
